page.title: 02LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS 2
page.content: 2 THE NAME NORTH SOMERCOTES HAS BEEN INTERPRETED TO INDICATE AN ORIGIN AS A SUMMER SETTLEMENTBY PASTORALISTS MAKING SUMMER USE OF THE COAST MARSHLANDS.IN FACT MANY OF THE OUTER SETTLEMENTS OF THE LINCS MARSHES HAVE SOME ELEMENT IN THEIR NAMES WHICH SUGGESTS THAT THEY ARE SECONDARY OR DAUGHTER SETTLEMENTS SPAWNED BY OLDER ANGLIAN OR NORSESETTLEMENTS ESTABLISHED ALONG THE EDGE OF THE MIDDLE MARSH.IMMEDIATELY TO THE EAST OF NORTH SOMERCOTES IS AN AREA OF LOW SAND HILLS.ORIGINALLY A STORM BEACH IT IS NOW OCCUPPIED BY A 25 YEAR OLD CONIFER PLANTATION AND A HOLIDAY CAMP WHICH SEEKS TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF A NUMBER OF SMALL LAKES WHICH ARE THE RESULT OF SAND AND GRAVEL EXTRACTION FOR PRE WORLD WAR 2 AIRFIELD BUILDING BUILDING.
